original_title: ComBank arrives in Anamaduwa with its 270th branch
original_body_lines: The Commercial Bank of Ceylon has opened the 270th branch in its Sri Lanka network in Anamaduwa, a rapidly developing area steeped in folklore.

The new branch located at No. 78, Uswewa Road, Anamaduwa in the Puttalam District, is equipped with an Automated Teller Machine (ATM), a Cash Recycler Machine (CRM) and a Cash Deposit Machine (CDM) that will provide access to services 24 hours of the day, 365 days of the year. With the opening of this branch, Commercial Bank’s network of automated machines in Sri Lanka grows to 950 terminals.

The Anamaduwa branch was formally declared open by Commercial Bank Chairman Prof. Ananda Jayawardane and the Bank’s Managing Director/CEO Sanath Manatunge, accompanied by Chief Operating Officer S. Prabagar and representatives of the senior and corporate management of the Bank.

In the picture, Commercial Bank Chairman Prof. Ananda Jayawardane (second from left) flanked by Managing Director/CEO Sanath Manatunge (third from left) and Chief Operating Officer S. Prabagar (extreme left) declares the branch open.
